c74object.name: ibufplayer~
c74object.description: An efficient playback object for ibuffer~ and standard buffer~ objects. ibufplayer~ features SIMD optimisation, individual channel level controls, reduced CPU usage for integer playback speeds and fixed speed, or varispeed (with a base speed) playback. Three different kinds of cubic interpolation are avaiable. It should be at least (roughly) as fast as groove~ in worst case scenarios, and faster in various other situations.

objarg.name: channels
objarg.description:
Setting an int as the first argument sets number of output channels.
The defualt number of channels is 1.

method.name: speed-input
method.description:
A signal input will change the playback speed of the set buffer~ / ibuffer~. This will only have an effect if the varispeed flag has been raised in the play message.
The playback speed will be centred on the base speed set in the play message.

method.name: interp
method.description:
Set the interpolation mode from a choice of:
bspline, lagrange or hermite.
The message should be formatted as:
interp / mode
The most efficient (and defualt) mode is bspline

method.name: play
method.description:
Sending just the play message will play the full ibuffer~ / buffer~ set by the set message.
The play message can be set with five arguments in the order:
buffer name / base speed / start point / end point / varispeed flag.
The buffer name corresponds to the ibuffer~ / buffer~ that you would like to play.
The base speed is a playback multiplier applied to the ibuffer~ / buffer~ set as a float. The default is 1.
The start point determines where (in milliseconds) in the ibuffer~ / buffer~ to begin playback set as an int. The default is 0.
The end point determines where (in milliseconds) in the ibuffer~ / buffer~ to end the playback set as an int. The default is the end of the buffer. Negative numbers also indicate the end of the buffer.
The varispeed flag is an int (0 or 1) that determines if playback speed should be effected by the speed-input. The playback speed will be centred around the base speed.

method.name: set
method.digest: Set the name of the (i)buffer for playback
method.description:
Set the name of the ibuffer~ / buffer~ that ibufplayer~ will play back when the play message is sent.
The message should be formatted as:
set / buffer name

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the playback coming out of ibufplayer~.

method.name: vols
method.digest: Set the volume for each channel
method.description:
Sending the vols message followed by a list of floats will set the output amplitudes, with each item in the list having a corresponding channel.
The message should be formatted as:
vols / list (where each item is a channel amplitude)

attribute.name: interp
attribute.description:
Set the interpolation mode for ibufplayer~ by specifying the mode as a symbol.
The modes are:
linear
hermite (defualt)
bspline
lagrange

entry.name: signal
entry.description: Output an interpolated value from a buffer as a signal.
